intro: Psephellus caucasicus, commonly known as Caucasian sandparsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. It is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
